title: <@U0180NKJP89> i'm porting these features over from the OG exponent repo to c-c exponent-evals
content:
=== Earlier conversation (context, already processed) ===
[2025-12-01T21:13:30.003Z] Karen Ying: <@U0180NKJP89> i'm porting these features over from the OG exponent repo to c-c exponent-evals
[2025-12-01T21:20:55.465Z] Kumail Jaffer: awesome, thanks
[2025-12-01T21:26:06.511Z] Evangeline: related: <https://gather-town.slack.com/archives/C09HTTVUSH5/p1764624127396999?thread_ts=1764617107.235119&cid=C09HTTVUSH5>
[2025-12-01T22:03:22.069Z] Karen Ying: <@U0180NKJP89> it might be easier for me to roll "add in frozen linear state to framework" into this since i'm porting that over

once i merge this (likely tn), you can see what frozen linear state improvements you wanna make?
[2025-12-01T22:07:30.050Z] Kumail Jaffer: I have a PR for this in progress rn <https://app.graphite.com/github/pr/gathertown/corporate-context/2205/Add-fixture-based-Linear-search-provider-for-controlled-evals>
[2025-12-01T22:08:04.513Z] Kumail Jaffer: so ff to not take it if it’s easier
[2025-12-01T22:08:35.450Z] Kumail Jaffer: but if it’s easier for you to just bring it over too, then also feel free to do that and I’ll dedup what I have before merging
[2025-12-01T22:10:40.511Z] Karen Ying: ooo this would work with `yarn eval` right?

im copying over the frozen linear state for `yarn checkpoints` so that we can take initial linear state and run cases chronologically that mutate it
[2025-12-01T22:10:46.587Z] Karen Ying: maybe both are useful!
[2025-12-01T22:12:51.788Z] Kumail Jaffer: oh wait what is yarn checkpoints
[2025-12-01T22:13:19.724Z] Kumail Jaffer: I think I will just wait for whatever you have to come in and then decide haha
[2025-12-01T22:14:36.946Z] Karen Ying: yarn checkpoints was how the OG exponent repo did evals with frozen linear state -- you could process a bunch of docs in order where the 1st doc had a frozen linear state and each subsequent doc would apply changes to the state :open_mouth:
[2025-12-01T22:14:50.671Z] Karen Ying: > I think I will just wait for whatever you have to come in and then decide haha
ah ok rip sorry for the duplicated work :bow::skin-tone-3:
[2025-12-01T22:49:55.869Z] Karen Ying: im gonna need a 1-2 more hours to work this out. i'll read your PR and see if i can pull the overlapping functionality over though! will report back

=== New messages since last pass (process these) ===
[2025-12-01T23:39:39.629Z] Karen Ying: ok i have a <https://github.com/gathertown/corporate-context/pull/2210|PR> that ports over `yarn checkpoint`

i think we should keep your `--linear-fixture` code btw so feel free to merge that! they serve different purposes

the main difference is just that with yarn checkpoint we manually paste in linear details like title, state, desc AND you can run checkpoint on multiple sequential files to see the full flow (but you can also run it on one file) whereas --linear-fixture fetches issues based on title for a single doc for ease + more realistic tickets (no sequential support)

_(although side note neither of these 2 use real Linear API search which is a lil sus_ :sussquint:_)_ 

i had claude summarize the differences:
